text: 1. Consider the declaration of the multi-dimensional array: int A[10]([10][10] We know that an integer can be stored in 4 bytes. The array is stored in row order, with increasing memory addresses (that is, if an element is at address i, its successor is at i + 4, and so on). The element A[0] [0] [0] is stored at address 0. State the address at which element A[2] [2] [5] is stored.
